title: Systems and methods for calibrating a machine learning model
abstract: Systems and methods include: collecting digital threat scores of an incumbent digital threat machine learning model; identifying incumbent and successor digital threat score distributions; identifying quantiles data of the incumbent digital threat score distribution; collecting digital threat scores of a successor digital threat machine learning model; calibrating the digital threat scores of the successor digital threat score distribution based on the quantiles data of the incumbent digital threat score distribution and the incumbent digital threat score distribution; and in response to remapping the digital threat scores of the successor digital threat score distribution, publishing the successor digital scores in lieu of the incumbent digital threat scores based on requests for digital threat scores.
claims:
1. A machine learning-based method for improving one or more machine learning models of a machine learning-based digital threat and/or digital fraud mitigation service, the machine learning-based method comprising:
implementing a machine learning-based digital threat or digital fraud mitigation service implemented by a distributed network of computers;
calibrating, by the machine learning-based digital threat or digital fraud mitigation service, an uncalibrated evolved machine learning model to a calibrated evolved machine learning model by:
remapping uncalibrated digital threat scores output by the uncalibrated evolved machine learning model based on quantiles data of a digital threat score distribution of a target machine learning model, wherein the remapping includes:
imposing the quantiles data of the target machine learning model onto the digital threat score distribution of the uncalibrated evolved machine learning model;
outputting calibrated digital threat scores based on the remapping of the uncalibrated digital threat scores of the uncalibrated evolved machine learning model; and
in response to digital threat score request to the machine learning-based digital threat or digital fraud mitigation service, publicly exposing one or more of the calibrated digital threat scores in lieu of digital threat scores of the target machine learning model.
2. The machine learning-based method according to claim 1, further comprising:
implementing the target machine learning model in a public mode of operation, wherein the digital threat scores generated by the target ML model are publicly returned in response to a request for a digital threat score for a digital event or a digital actor, and
implementing the uncalibrated evolved machine learning model in a private mode of operation, wherein the digital threat scores generated by the uncalibrated evolved machine learning model are privately stored and not publicly returned in response to the one or more requests for the digital threat score for the digital event.
3. The machine learning-based method according to claim 2, wherein:
implementing the target machine learning model and the evolved machine learning model are operated in parallel.
4. The machine learning-based method according to claim 1, further comprising:
in response to receiving a request for a digital threat score for a digital event or a digital actor, providing equivalent digital event data associated with the digital event or the digital actor as machine learning input into both the target machine learning model and the uncalibrated evolved machine learning model.
5. The machine learning-based method according to claim 1, wherein the remapping includes:
generating a function based on the quantiles data of the target digital threat score distribution and the quantiles data of the uncalibrated evolved digital threat score distribution;
applying the function to the uncalibrated evolved digital threat score distribution to preserve the target digital threat score distribution.
6. The machine learning-based method according to claim 1, wherein:
the remapping is triggered based on a detection of the quantiles data of the target digital threat score distribution and of the target and evolved digital threat score distributions.
7. The machine learning-based method according to claim 1, further comprising:
generating a count value for each of the target digital threat scores and for each of the evolved digital threat scores, wherein:
the remapping includes pairing target digital threat scores and evolved digital threat scores having a same count value.
8. The machine learning-based method of claim 1, wherein
machine learning-based digital threat or digital fraud mitigation service calibrates the uncalibrated evolved machine learning model independent of knowledge of automated decisioning thresholds of a service provider for which digital threat scores are output to from the calibrated evolved machine learning model.
9. The machine learning-based method of claim 1, further comprising:
testing a classification accuracy of the calibrated evolved machine learning model, wherein testing includes:
providing a same digital event data input set to the uncalibrated evolved machine learning model and the calibrated evolved machine learning model;
generating score distributions of each of the uncalibrated evolved machine learning model and the calibrated evolved machine learning model
generating a receiver operating characteristics curve for the score distributions of each of the uncalibrated evolved machine learning model and the calibrated evolved machine learning model;
identifying a level of match between the receiver operating characteristics curves for the uncalibrated evolved machine learning model and the calibrated evolved machine learning model.
10. The machine learning-based method of claim 1, further comprising:
measuring a sensitivity level of a service provider to a proposed migration to the calibrated evolved model; and
if the sensitivity level satisfies one or more sensitivity thresholds, triggering an automatic calibration of the calibrated evolved machine learning model.
11. The machine learning-based method of claim 1, further comprising:
measuring a sensitivity level of a service provider to a proposed migration to the calibrated evolved machine learning model; and
if the sensitivity level does not satisfy one or more sensitivity thresholds, triggering an automatic live implementation of the calibrated evolved machine learning model.
12. A method of calibrating a machine learning model of a machine learning-based service, the method comprising:
implementing a machine learning-based digital threat or digital fraud mitigation service implemented by a distributed network of computers;
calibrating, by the machine learning-based digital threat or digital fraud mitigation service, an uncalibrated evolved machine learning model to a calibrated evolved machine learning model by:
rewriting the digital threat scores of the uncalibrated evolved machine learning model to fit within quantiles based on quantiles data associated with a digital threat score distribution of a target machine learning model;
outputting calibrated digital threat scores based on the rewriting of the uncalibrated digital threat scores of the uncalibrated evolved machine learning model; and
in response to digital threat score request to the machine learning-based digital threat or digital fraud mitigation service, publicly exposing one or more of the calibrated digital threat scores in lieu of digital threat scores of the target machine learning model.
13. The method according to claim 12, wherein
a count of the digital threat scores of the calibrated evolved machine learning model between each index of a calibrated digital threat score distribution of the calibrated evolved machine learning model matches a count of the digital threat scores between each index of the digital threat score distribution of the target machine learning model.
